data.title: Murder Over New York (1940)
data.meta_description: When Charlie's old friend from Scotland Yard is murdered when they attend a police convention in New York, Chan picks up the case he was working on.
data.text:
"Round up all the Hindus in New York!" which ends up being about a dozen, including Shemp Howard. Shemp is faking it, though, a faking Fakir. In the most surreal moment of the series so far, they grab a pail of water, rip off his fake beard, and wash his face, revealing he's a white man in brownface. Sidney Toler sits watching, grinning. Yes, an actor in yellowface who is supposed to actually be Chinese is watching an actor in brownface getting his makeup washed off and exposed as a fraud, but before I can absorb the meta-commentary, Jimmy Chan (Victor Sen Yung) says, "I don't know which one did it - they all look alike to me!" OK, now…

Harry Lachman’s crime mystery comedy in which Charlie Chan’s old pal from Scotland Yard is killed when they go to a police convention in New York. Starring Sidney Toler and Marjorie Weaver.

This entry in the Charlie Chan franchise concentrates on the detective Charlie Chan (Sidney Toler) and No. 2 son who attempt to stop a spy ring damaging bombers for England, with Charlie also trying to solve a murder.

Sidney Toler gives a good performance in his role as the title character Charlie Chan, the Chinese detective who is determined to find out who is responsible for committing the murder, as well as locating who is accountable for the spy ring.

Elsewhere, there is a fine performance to be…

War is approaching and saboteurs are afoot. But so is Charlie Chan. And Son #2. What chance do the bad guys have. As usual Charlie is minding his own business on the way to a Police Convention in New York City, but trouble comes his way. On the plane he runs into an old friend from Scotland Yard now in British Intelligence - the film's way of saying who are the good guys and who are the bad guys without actually saying so and annoying the American Firsters. He tells Charlie that he is on the track of a master saboteur named Navo. But he doesn't know where he is and has likely taken on a new identity and a…
